description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7g75","text":"Single-cell RNA sequencing has emerged as a powerful method to characterize gene expression  on a single cell level. Producing useful data with this method critically relies on obtaining a  suspension of dissociated cells with high concentration and viability from the tissue of interest.  This protocol allows to isolate and dissociate mouse brain cellsinto a concentrated cell suspension  that is compatible with the 10X Genomics library preparation and sequencing pipeline and  enables capturing up to 10,000 single cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Cardiac perfusion system (gravity-driven), which consists of a 60-ml syringe secured ~65 cm above the working surface for mouse dissection with 1/4'' ID tubing (~1m long) ending with a Luer connection to a 20G needle. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3o32n","text":"Figure 1 shows a representative image of the cell suspension loaded in hemocytometer for counting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3jpm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"v3rqr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"52gj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f2qc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1f5n6","text":"https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/sample-prep/doc/demonstrated-protocol-single-cell-protocols-cell-preparation-guide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":142}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e5kco","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":69}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3oeva","text":"Please note that this image was captured for demonstration purposes ~  after cell isolation, which resulted in  a much higher number of dead cells (stained blue) than fresh preparation to be used in an actual experiment for  downstream processing. Otherwise, the image gives a general idea of how the isolated cell suspension looks like  during the hemocytometer counting step. steps.section: Part 2. Experimental procedure on the day of experiment.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6qbi","text":"Cut skin above skull from caudal to rostral end and peel away to expose skull.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part 2. Experimental procedure on the day of experiment.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3nu0e","text":"Make a midline cut with scissors in the skull towards the eye sockets. Use fine Graefe forceps to break and peel pieces of skull away from midline, exposing the brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part 2. Experimental procedure on the day of experiment.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2o52g","text":"Make a coronal cut with scissors between olfactory bulbs and the rest of the brain, and another cut between the brain and spinal cord to mobilize the brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part 2. Experimental procedure on the day of experiment.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"59jp7","text":"Use a spatula to slightly lift the brain from the skull, use scissors to cut optical tracts, and finally extract the mobilized brain from the skull with a spatula (hippocampal tool) and push it into the Petri dish with the Brain Perfusion Solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
